reviews.title: Good Food, Friendly Server
reviews.text: Had a group of 20 on the back patio on a Friday night. Our server was Robin was very nice. It took a while for the food to come out, so I'm not sure they are prepared for large groups. However, no one complained about the food, it was very good. we had reserved the table in advance for a party of 14, so they knew we were coming, just think the kitchen was overwhelmed.

Each time we have dined here our food is wonderful. The service is always friendly and informative - they really know their stuff!! The food is great - from the chicken to the beef to the sea food. Good atmosphere too - whether you dine in or on the patio.
reviews.title: Just as Classy as the Hotel
Great food!
reviews.text: Would eat here again. We ate on the patio and listened to live music. The food was really good and I can't wait to go back! Nice location.

reviews.title: Fancy
reviews.text: They need to expand their menu. What we had was very good. The prices I thought were a little high for the amount of food you received. The catering service is good. The servers are nice.

reviews.title: Spats
reviews.text: This place is by far the best restaurant in Parkersburg. Great food, service and atmosphere. Definitely go here if you’re in the area.

reviews.title: Nicest place to eat in Parkersburg
reviews.text: The food is great. The service is 1st rate. The atmosphere is great. The wine selection is NUTS! Some evenings they have live music on the patio. I give this place a big thumbs up!

Four years ago on a road trip East, we stopped - based on a recommendation from a friend - at Spats for lunch. We love the hotel location/appearance and the dining room as well as our meal and decided if/when we ever were in the area again we'd stop. Well, last week we not only returned to the restaurant, we spent a night in the hotel (another review). We ate dinner and breakfast the next morning. Both meals were very good!
reviews.title: two very very nice meals here
Wonderful!
reviews.text: For dinner we shared French onion soup (excellent), shared a spinach salad - excellent and very reasonable in price ($4.) and shared a tournado's entree - excellent. Our waitress had the kitchen split the entree between two plates and it was obvious they added extra vegtables to each plate. All was very satisfying. We also had a cocktail each (average in pour) and a very very reasonable bottle of wine. Our waitress was delightful and paced our meal well.

reviews.title: Just OK
reviews.text: For breakfast the next morning we each had an omelet - we had many choices (veggies and/or meat) to be added to the omelet; it came with bacon or sausage and toast (the rye bread toast was especially good). Everything was hot and tasty. And once again we had great service.
For both meals the restaurant was relatively empty I think because we stayed and ate on an off night (Sunday evening/Monday morning).
reviews.title: Menu a little bit different from 'the usual'
Excellent Service
reviews.text: We ate breakfast and dinner and both meals offered great choices and the food was fresh and delicious.

My family, myself, and elderly father were heading to South Carolina this june from northern PA and decided to make a stop in Parkersburg at the Blennerhassett Hotel. Once we got our rooms situated we headed down to the hotel restaurant: Spats. We had a great experience and will recommend the restaurant to our friends and coworkers. Our waiter Seth was extremely helpful, cordial, and professional. He took special care to suggest the best entrees and a great bottle of wine to go along with our meals. He also managed to find something my father enjoyed, and at 97 that is not easy task! We have stayed in Parkersburg before, Spats is the best place in town for sophisticated service, great wine selection, and excellent fare.
reviews.title: Great restaurant and better service.

reviews.text: My family and myself recommend Spats without reservations to anyone near the Parkersburg area! Don’t miss out on the creme brulee!
reviews.title: Pre-play supper
Fine dining and great atmosphere
reviews.text: We were headed to a play at the Actor's Guild, just up the street, so this was the perfect location for supper before the show. The place was surprisingly ...ahhh...under attended. It is a classy place with food and wine to match, but at typical restaurant prices (plus a small bit). Good value. And great atmosphere.

reviews.title: Be Selective and You'll be Happy Here
reviews.text: I have been heard there is live music on the patio on summer Saturdays.

reviews.title: Good, but not creative
reviews.text: The menu leaves a little to be desired. If you're like me and want a lot of choices, then you might be disappointed like I was.

reviews.title: Great Food!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Blennerhassett and enjoyed Spats! Super creative menu-loved the wine list-very extensive and much appreciated. Great live music on Saturday night. Service was good-not great. The food was so good-we dined 2 nights and were very impressed!

reviews.title: Great Sunday Brunch
reviews.text: I ate there twice during my stay both for brunch - once a sit down order (eggs bene is very good, smoked salmon bagel plate my guest had was good too) and on Sunday for brunch. The brunch buffet is about $17 and I would consider it a good value as it has everything from the basic breakfast items, to roast pork, chicken, pasta, omlettes, fresh fruit, and pastry.

reviews.title: Delicious Breakfast
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is delicious, elegant, and reasonably priced. I enjoyed sitting in comfy chairs, dining with real dishes, and watching the historic Parkersburg neighborhood out the windows as I ate.

We ate Breakfast and dinner here. Both were amazing meals. The food was exceptional along with the atmosphere and service. Reasonably priced. The wine list is extensive and the servers are well educated in the wines to help you pair them with your entree. If you are in Parkersburg, EAT HERE!
reviews.title: Amazing
